original: The system SHOULD issue a unique API key or token to each partner for secure access, with support for optional IP whitelisting, usage limits, and token expiration management to ensure controlled and secure integration.
rewritten: The system shall issue a unique API key or token to each partner for secure access, with support for optional IP whitelisting, usage limits, and token expiration management to ensure controlled and secure integration.

original: The system SHOULD support job posting via a secure RESTful Push API, allowing external platforms to submit job opportunities directly to the job matching system.
rewritten: The system shall support job posting via a secure RESTful Push API, allowing external platforms to submit job opportunities directly to the job matching system.

original: The system SHOULD provide a testing environment for external job sites to validate their integration.
rewritten: The system shall provide a testing environment for external job sites to validate their integration.

original: The system SHOULD implement comprehensive error handling and response logging by providing clear API response codes with descriptive messages for success, failure, duplicates, and validation errors.
rewritten: The system shall implement comprehensive error handling and response logging by providing clear API response codes with descriptive messages for success, failure, duplicates, and validation errors.

original: The system SHOULD grant external platforms access to view submission logs for monitoring and troubleshooting purposes.
rewritten: The system shall grant external platforms access to view submission logs for monitoring and troubleshooting purposes.

original: The system SHOULD return a unique job ID as a confirmation response after a job is successfully pushed via the API, enabling accurate record-keeping and integration synchronization for external systems.
rewritten: The system shall return a unique job ID as a confirmation response after a job is successfully pushed via the API, enabling accurate record-keeping and integration synchronization for external systems.

original: The system SHOULD support job synchronization of updates via the API, enabling external job sites to modify job details—such as deadline extensions, description edits, or early closure/deletion/deactivation—using the assigned job ID.
rewritten: The system shall support job synchronization of updates via the API, enabling external job sites to modify job details—such as deadline extensions, description edits, or early closure/deletion/deactivation—using the assigned job ID.

original: The system SHOULD provide an optional sync dashboard—a lightweight web interface or endpoint—that allows partners to review the status of jobs posted via the API, including indicators for synced, failed, pending, and archived records.
rewritten: The system shall provide an optional sync dashboard—a lightweight web interface or endpoint—that allows partners to review the status of jobs posted via the API, including indicators for synced, failed, pending, and archived records.

original: The system SHOULD also offer periodic or real-time access to integration usage statistics—such as the number of jobs submitted, matched, and viewed—for transparency, performance tracking, and reporting purposes.
rewritten: The system shall also offer periodic or real-time access to integration usage statistics—such as the number of jobs submitted, matched, and viewed—for transparency, performance tracking, and reporting purposes.

original: The system SHOULD provide access to the up-to-date API schema (e.g., via Swagger) and detailed field validation rules to ensure proper formatting and structure of job postings submitted through the API.
rewritten: The system shall provide access to the up-to-date API schema (e.g., via Swagger) and detailed field validation rules to ensure proper formatting and structure of job postings submitted through the API.

original: The system SHOULD provide an option for source platforms to configure whether their attribution (e.g., source platform name) appears publicly on job postings or is only visible within the admin panel and system logs.
rewritten: The system shall provide an option for source platforms to configure whether their attribution appears publicly on job postings or is only visible within the admin panel and system logs.

original: The system SHOULD maintain an audit trail at the job level, recording which external job site created or modified each posting, and display this information within the MoL admin dashboard for traceability and accountability.
rewritten: The system shall maintain an audit trail at the job level, recording which external job site created or modified each posting, and display this information within the MoL admin dashboard for traceability and accountability.

original: The system SHALL allow administrators to oversee job offerings by viewing active and inactive postings, changes in posts, and to suspend or remove job offerings that are deemed inappropriate or violate platform policies.
rewritten: The system shall allow administrators to oversee job offerings by viewing active and inactive postings, changes in posts, and to suspend or remove job offerings that are deemed inappropriate or violate platform policies.

original: The system SHALL implement secure authentication mechanisms including username/password, email verification, and multi-factor authentication options.
rewritten: The system shall implement secure authentication mechanisms including username/password, email verification, and multi-factor authentication options.

original: The system SHALL provide a structured job posting form that allows employers to add new job opportunities with the following fields: Job title, summary, and required skills (with support for file upload or copy/paste input) Contract type (e.g., full-time, part-time, training, project-based) Required education level Application deadline with an optional auto-close feature Work format selection (Physical with employment location, Online, or Hybrid) Gender, number of employees, etc Required languages and proficiency levels Link to the job if available. More detailed features on the job post to be provided.
rewritten: The system shall provide a structured job posting form that allows employers to add new job opportunities with the following fields: Job title, summary, and required skills (with support for file upload or copy/paste input) Contract type (e.g., full-time, part-time, training, project-based) Required education level Application deadline with an optional auto-close feature Work format selection (Physical with employment location, Online, or Hybrid) Gender, number of employees, etc. Required languages and proficiency levels Link to the job if available. More detailed features on the job post to be provided.

original: The system SHALL use a scoring algorithm to calculate a match score between job seekers and job postings minimally based on the following criteria: Skill overlap Education match Training match Location match Experience range Salary expectation range
rewritten: The system shall use a scoring algorithm to calculate a match score between job seekers and job postings minimally based on the following criteria: Skill overlap Education match Training match Location match Experience range Salary expectation range

original: The system SHALL provide confidence scores for extracted information and highlight areas that may need manual verification.
rewritten: The system shall provide confidence scores for extracted information and highlight areas that may need manual verification.

original: The system SHOULD provide APIs for real-time job data synchronization with external job sites.
rewritten: The system shall provide APIs for real-time job data synchronization with external job sites.

original: The system SHOULD implement data mapping and transformation to standardize job postings from different sources.
rewritten: The system shall implement data mapping and transformation to standardize job postings from different sources.

original: The system SHOULD support both pull (importing jobs from external sites) and push (exporting jobs to external sites) integration models.
rewritten: The system shall support both pull (importing jobs from external sites) and push (exporting jobs to external sites) integration models.

original: The system SHOULD maintain synchronization logs and provide error handling for failed integrations.
rewritten: The system shall maintain synchronization logs and provide error handling for failed integrations.

original: The system SHOULD support scheduled and on-demand synchronization options.
rewritten: The system shall support scheduled and on-demand synchronization options.

original: The system SHOULD provide a dashboard to monitor integration status and data flow with external job sites.
rewritten: The system shall provide a dashboard to monitor integration status and data flow with external job sites.

original: The system SHOULD integrate with relevant government databases for data verification and enrichment.
rewritten: The system shall integrate with relevant government databases for data verification and enrichment.

original: The system SHOULD support integration with the MoL and PEF existing databases and systems.
rewritten: The system shall support integration with the MoL and PEF existing databases and systems.

original: The system SHOULD support verification of educational credentials through integration with educational institution databases.
rewritten: The system shall support verification of educational credentials through integration with educational institution databases.

original: The system SHOULD provide options for identity verification through government ID systems.
rewritten: The system shall provide options for identity verification through government ID systems.

original: The system SHOULD maintain audit trails of all data exchanges with government systems.
rewritten: The system shall maintain audit trails of all data exchanges with government systems.

original: The system SHOULD respect data privacy regulations when accessing and using government data.
rewritten: The system shall respect data privacy regulations when accessing and using government data.

original: The system SHOULD provide a comprehensive API framework for integration with external systems.
rewritten: The system shall provide a comprehensive API framework for integration with external systems.

original: The system SHOULD implement RESTful APIs with JSON data format as the primary integration method.
rewritten: The system shall implement RESTful APIs with JSON data format as the primary integration method.

original: The system SHOULD provide detailed API documentation with examples and testing tools.
rewritten: The system shall provide detailed API documentation with examples and testing tools.

original: The system SHOULD implement OAuth 2.0 for API authentication and authorization.
rewritten: The system shall implement OAuth 2.0 for API authentication and authorization.

original: The system SHOULD support API versioning to ensure backward compatibility.
rewritten: The system shall support API versioning to ensure backward compatibility.

original: MOL Life dashboard should include current logins, number of current logins and last sessions, with links to these users profiles
rewritten: MOL Life dashboard shall include current logins, number of current logins and last sessions, with links to these users profiles.

original: The system SHOULD generate employment statistics and labor market insights from platform data.
rewritten: The system shall generate employment statistics and labor market insights from platform data.

original: The system SHOULD track key metrics including job posting trends, application rates, hiring rates, and time-to-fill.
rewritten: The system shall track key metrics including job posting trends, application rates, hiring rates, and time-to-fill.

original: The system SHOULD provide industry-specific analytics on job market demand and supply.
rewritten: The system shall provide industry-specific analytics on job market demand and supply.

rewritten: The system shall analyze skill demand trends to identify emerging requirements and skill gaps.

rewritten: The system shall generate geographic distribution reports for jobs and candidates.

rewritten: The system shall provide salary range analytics by industry, position, and location.

original: The system SHOULD track employment outcomes and career progression where data is available.
rewritten: The system shall track employment outcomes and career progression where data is available.

original: The system SHOULD generate periodic labor market reports for government stakeholders.
rewritten: The system shall generate periodic labor market reports for government stakeholders.

original: The system SHOULD monitor and report on system performance metrics.
rewritten: The system shall monitor and report on system performance metrics.

original: The system SHOULD track matching algorithm performance including accuracy, precision, recall, and user satisfaction.

rewritten: The system shall track technical performance metrics including response times, resource utilization, and error rates.

rewritten: The system shall provide dashboards for administrators to monitor system health and performance.

rewritten: The system shall generate alerts for performance issues or anomalies.
